text.content:
ED NURSING ASSESSMENT:
Chief Complaint: pt ambulated to er bed 3 
here for elevated temp and sob today. Pts temp is now 97.4
20g to Lhand PTA, albuterol t-ment given by emts. 


APPEARANCE: No acute distress
MOBILITY: 
Assistive devices used: n/a
MENTAL SCREEN:
Alert and responsive.
Oriented to name, place, date, SS#
PAIN ASSESSMENT (WILDCATS)
   Patient denies pain or discomfort. 
 
SYSTEMS REVIEW:
   SKIN:
   Skin Color
      Normal for ethnic group 
   Temperature
      Warm 
   Skin Moisture
      Dry
   PULMONARY:
Respirations
   Normal 

Lungs:
   Clear  LUL, LLL, RUL, RML, RLL
Cough
No cough 
   ABDOMINAL ASSESSMENT
   Abdomen    soft
   Bowel sounds: normal
   Bowel Frequency 
   GI problems    none 
   Patient is continent
 
0746-   PTA 20g to pts L hand. Labs collected, orders pending. 

0815-   Unable to obtain blood cultures from piv. 

0828-   Pt to x-ray via stretcher s distress or discomfort.

0840-   pt remains in x-ray, report to nurse, seven RN.
text.author: NURSE,NINE

text.content:
0750 Report received from Nurse Eight RN. 
 
0830 CXR in Radiology, pt taken by ER CNA.
 
0855 Pt returned to ER on gurney by ER CNA.
 
0915-0925 Blood cultures x2 drawn and sent to the lab per Provider MD. 
 
0930-1000 CC urine specimen for UA/C&S sent to the lab. MRSA swab sent 
for admission. 
 
1000 VS:107/51(68) HR 108, 91% O2 sat by pulse ox on 4L NC.
 
1050 After MD texted the pharmacy several times, the Abx for this pt 
were brought to the ER. This RN also called and spoke to the pharmacist. 
Cefepime IVPB was started and infused without difficulty or reaction. 
 
1130 Cipro given IVPB started. 
 
1200 Report given to Nurse Ten RN. VS:97/42(50), HR 102, 95% O2 sat on 4L
NC.
 
1215 pt to 3E north via stretcher by ER LPN.
text.author: NURSE,SEVEN

nationalTitle.title: RN EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT E & M NOTE
